translations.translation: Come on, the two of us sit in the shade.
The sun is shining hot.
Whose is this dog running around?

notes: Not sure these glosses are right - doesn't make a lot of sense? (changed waranga to dative).
dhithiani shows that ani can go on vowel-final stems without hiatus resolution.

translations.translation: My father's dog is running around.
Chase that dog away.
‎‎It could bite that kid.

sentences.transcription: manhdhawari yandraanha nhanhaguru/ bandidhikara nhanhaguru dhithianha

translations.translation: Pick up a stone, hit him away, that dog.
Uncle is making a boomerang.
My uncle is making a boomerang.
Uncle is making it for me. OR Uncle is making the boomerang. It is for me. OR Uncle is making (it). The boomerang is for me.
This is not your boomerang.
‎‎That boomerang is my father's.

notes: Possible that nganyta is spelling/hearing mistake for nganytya

translations.translation: Whose is that spear lying in the grass there?
‎‎Whose is that?
‎‎Pick up that spear. (It) might break.
‎‎Lean it standing up.
Yes, (I) pick that one up.
Put it up there in the shade.
His father is going away.

notes: Factive here (perhaps related tot hat -lya form that showed up?)

translations.translation: Who picked up my stick here?
I couldn't/didn't find my stick.
I picked it up and threw it in the fire.
Finished, burnt that one down there in the fire.
I'll pick up a stick, that one/for you.

notes: Check if there's a word boundary missing for makurawatyuanha

translations.translation: Come away, the dog could bite you.
That one down there is playing with the good dog.
The dog is fighting the kangaroo.

sentences.transcription: walya wina yanhthadhira/ galkalangu inha nhandruguru dhaldraandru

translations.translation: Don't go too close, the kangaroo could kill you.
Don't go too close, the two of us will kill it with a spear.

notes: changed gloss from ablative to instrumental.

translations.translation: Stand back.
I didn't hit it.
‎‎(Give) me a stick.
Finished/O.K., I killed it.
Call your dog off.
That one is tearing up the meat.

sentences.transcription: nalyba nganha ngutya gakagakara nguthianha nhanha

translations.translation: Give me a knife to cut up the meat there.

sentences.transcription: nhanha ngathu durkaanha waltagala nganytya gawulidyaanga nguraanga ngutyara ngathu nhanha nguthianha

translations.translation: I am taking this leg to my uncle's camp to give him the meat.
